attributes.title: Right Context is More Important Than Action
attributes.description:
Paramahamsa Nithyananda begins the 10th Verse of Ishavasya Upanishad:

anyad evāhur vidyayā-anyad āhur avidyayā |
iti śuśruma dhīrāṇaṁ   ye nastad vicacakṣire || 10 ||

Paramahamsa Nithyananda shares a profound, important sacred secret - the context you set for you, before entering into action or life, is more important than your decision into entering or not entering into life or what you do or don’t do in life. 
If you set the context for Bhakti, your journey becomes pilgrimage, food becomes prasadam, water becomes tirtha, ash becomes bhasma, music becomes kirtans - man becomes human.
